title: Why do we wrinkle when wet?

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: It causes the skin to contract.

options.label: D

options.label: B
options.text: It helps us breathe better in wet conditions.

options.label: C
options.text: It helps us see better in low light.

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Those with wrinkly fingers picked up both wet and dry objects faster.

options.label: D
options.text: There was no difference between the two groups.

options.label: A
options.text: Because it would be too sensitive.

options.label: B
options.text: Because shriveled fingers and toes are less sensitive.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it would be too dry.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it would be too cold.

multiple-choice.question: What did the researchers find in the patient with nerve damage?

options.label: A
options.text: His fingers and toes wrinkled normally.

options.label: B
options.text: His fingers and toes remained smooth.

options.label: C
options.text: His fingers wrinkled but his toes didn't.

options.label: D
options.text: His toes wrinkled but his fingers didn't.

options.label: B
options.text: To improve traction on wet roads.

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: D

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: B
options.text: A member of the Stolen Generation

title: How your split ends can help clean oil spills

options.label: C

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary characteristic of hair that makes it useful for cleaning up oil spills?
